blockquote.a: Homer Community Schools Home of the Trojans

div.a: Has your family's financial situation changed? You may qualify for FREE food!!

span.p: Michigan recently announced that it is the first state to provide food to families affected by school closings caused by COVID-19 through a new program for families with children who receive free or reduced cost lunches at school. If you are currently qualified to receive free or reduced lunches, you should be receiving your information on this program.

If you did not previously qualify for free/reduced lunch and your family financial situation has changed due to job loss or reduction in hours, take a moment and complete the application at the link below! We don't want you to miss out on this additional support!

span.a: Complete a fast, easy online application at

img.alt: lunch app logo
cafeteria pic

span.p: This new program is not connected with the free meals that we provide on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays at the school. These meals are free to ALL students.
To reach the full press release regarding the details of this program, click HERE.

img.alt: senior celebration

span.p: Anyone can recognize Seniors for one day (and in only one way), but few choose to celebrate and recognize them all week long!!!...Welcome to THE HOMER DIFFERENCE (Difference #2020)!!!

Senior Yard Sign Display...We will be displaying 99 Senior Yard Signs tomorrow morning up and down M-99. The yard signs will be proudly displayed in our “front yard” all week long!!! Honk for a Senior when you drive by!!!

Cover Photo Challenge...Everyone is encouraged to change their cover photo on Facebook to help recognize and celebrate our awesome and unforgettable Senior Class. Superintendent Scott Salow will post the Senior Cover Photo on his FB page on Monday morning.

a.title: Click to read more about: Senior Celebration Week - April 19-25

div.a: Read More about Senior Celebration Week - April 19-25
Beyond the Bricks...Check out our new Continuity of Learning Plan website!

span.p: Are you ready for distance learning? We are very excited to release our new Continuity of Learning Plan website! This site contains all of the information that you need as a student or parent to understand and navigate our Plan! Looking for teacher's weekly lesson plans? Looking for daily activities to do with you child? Looking for easy access to teacher's emails or contact information? It's all here! To access the site, look under the Quick Links menu on the district homepage and select

Check out this quick tutorial on how to easily use the website! (This tutorial is focused specifically on content for toward elementary students, but the site contains pages specific to each building!)
All students that have currently signed up for a Chromebook have one ready to be picked up! Chromebooks can be picked up at the lunch drive through, from 11:00 - 12:00.

To provide more specific details on the learning expectations for the elementary, middle school and high school. the principals have each written a letter that is being mailed to the families in their buildings. Due to longer mail delivery times during this COVID-19 crisis, we are making these letters available digitally to help disperse the information in a timely manner.

a.span: Lillian Fletcher Elementary Family Letter from Mrs. Heather Cahill
Homer Middle School Family Letter from Mr. Duane Sitkiewicz
Homer High School Family Letter (Gr 9-11) from Mr. Tom Salow
Homer High School Senior Letter from Mr. Tom Salow
